intro: Byttneria longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf byttneria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The bark and leaves of Byttneria longifolia have been used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
